entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 11:35AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Rivers Draining the Brooks Range... Several weather fronts moving across the Brooks Range will bring rising water levels to rivers and streams. Rainfall totals from 0.75 to 1.75 inches are possible through Friday. Some isolated locations could see higher amounts. At this time, water levels are expected to remain within bank and below flood stage. Those

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 8:31AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY... A quick moving but moist atmospheric river is still on track and will move across the area starting Tuesday afternoon and persist into Wednesday evening. Streams and rivers will rise rapidly but at this time are expected to remain within their banks. Rain amounts will range from 1.50 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts. Some
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 3:25PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Thunderstorms Chances increasing this Week... * Another surge of monsoon moisture will continue thunderstorm chances across the region this week, with the best chances extending through Thursday before diminishing into the weekend. * Most areas will see a 25-45% chance of storms in the afternoon and early evening hours. Nocturnal showers are possible tonight
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 16 at 3:00PM PDT until August 18 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HOT DRY AND UNSTABLE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY... .HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL CLIMB BACK INTO THE UPPER 90S TO TRIPPLE DIGITS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. POOR OVERNIGHT RELATIVE HUMIDITY RECOVERY WILL ACCOMPANY THE HOT AND DRY DAYTIME CONDITIONS ALONG WITH AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM WEDNESDAY TO 10 PM PDT

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Louis, northeastern Carlton and northwestern Douglas Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 829 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from City of Rice Lake, to near Scanlon, to near Mahtowa, moving east at 15 mph.
